intro: Trochocarpa laurina, commonly known as the laurelberry, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and heathers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a strong aromatic scent. Trochocarpa laurina thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats.
